title: Fallout: New Vegas
notes: Game works fine, but it's not possible to enable HDR and antialiasing at the same time without graphical bugs (white/black squares flashing), same problem exists in regular Wine. Apparently some people had this problem even on real Windows when the game was new and complained about Bethesda never patching it (search the web). Since game worked fine in Windows last year for me, maybe Nvidia (possibly AMD too) eventually just added a workaround for it in their Windows drivers?

title: Fallout: New Vegas

gpu: Intel Open Source Technology Center Mesa DRI Intel(R) HD Graphics 520 (Skylake GT2) x86/MMX/SSE2
notes:
Played for a few hours. Game is stable and performance decent, but there are some issues:
- some non-essential missing audio (mostly music)
- hotkeys 6 and 7 are not detected (keys 1-5 and 8 work fine). Might be related to non-QWERTY keyboard layout, but on Windows this is not a problem.
- On medium graphics the framerate mostly stayed over 30 even under moderate load, but on rare occasions suddenly dropped to an unplayable 5 during intense battles. Unsure whether the same would happen on Windows with this GPU.

title: Fallout: New Vegas

notes:
I had to install the game via Lutris installer and then copy/paste the game files into the correct steam game's path. If i use the default game files i get things disappearing (even the HUD) even if i disabled bloom/hdr and antialiasing.
Using the lutris installer solve this issue. 
The issue report can be found here > https://github.com/ValveSoftware/Proton/issues/356
title: Fallout: New Vegas

gpu: X.Org Radeon RX 580 Series (POLARIS10, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.15-1-MANJARO, LLVM 7.0.0)
notes: Performance is actually better than my Windows install. Only thing I had to do was disable the bloom and/or glare effects. They cause random lighted spots to flicker when facing a reflective object, and also caused the UI to disappear when near the edge of the map. With that disabled, performance is excellent, no issues or bugs at all. It seems a lot of the bugs New Vegas has on Windows don't exist on Proton.
title: Fallout: New Vegas

title: Fallout: New Vegas

notes:
The game works flawlessly after a few tweaks. However, Alt-Tabbing does not work, not even if you enable a virtual desktop. I've also noticed that you might experience sped up animations if your monitor has a refresh rate higher than 60Hz (enabling/disabling VSync does not help).


If the animations are way too fast (aka, you have a high refresh rate monitor) you'll need to cap your framerate using a mod:


1)Download FPS limiter here: https://www.nexusmods.com/newvegas/mods/43784/


2)Extract d3d9.dll and antilag.cfg to /home/<your username>/.steam/steam/steamapps/common/Fallout New Vegas/ (remember, the DLL and CFG must be in the same folder as FalloutNV.exe and NOT in another subfolder!)


3) Open a terminal and write the following commands (keeping in mind to change the version number if you use a different version of Proton):


export WINE=$HOME/.steam/steam/steamapps/common/Proton\ 3.7/dist/bin/wine


export WINEPREFIX=$HOME/.steam/steam/steamapps/compatdata/22380/pfx


$HOME/.steam/steam/steamapps/common/Proton\ 3.7/dist/bin/wine winecfg


4)Click on the libraries tab and write d3d9.dll in the combobox under "New override for library", click add, then double check in "Existing overrides" that d3d9 is set to native,builtin (if not click edit and choose native, then builtin)


5)Apply the settings, launch New Vegas and go to options. Set Screen Effects to None and tweak the others to your liking!
title: Fallout: New Vegas
